favourite.article: Just keep playing the same chord until it sounds bad, then switch :)

@Andrew & anyone else interested: the guitar chords listed are from the original score, not written for guitar. A lot of times, simplify the chords by playing one per measure, whichever chord makes sense with the most notes. So, start on D, until the word abiding (v1), which is G, then D next measure.

Love the song, but I was wondering, can y'all lower the amount of chords for the guitar, not just on this song but on all? Just seems like there are way too many chords in the song, doesn't sound right.
For my ways His ceaseless presence guards and guides me every hour. "Lord may everything we do and say issue from living in Your sweet presence."

This song is very uplifting. All I need to do is to abide in Him and to confide in His word, then I can hide in the bosom of His love. He is Saviour, Sanctifier, Healer, Glorious Lord and coming King.
Lord, please teach me the wondrous secret of abiding in You.
